text: scripting language to remove license preamble on files

I want to recursively replace the "blah blah blah"
in my License region with nothing:

code:
#region License
blah blah blah
blah blah blah
#endregion

text: This should apply to all of of my .cs files in a certain directory (recursive).
I tried this with sed, but since I am on windows, I had some problems with line endings.
How can I do this with perl (or python), or something native to windows?
EDIT:  here is the solution I came up with, thanks to everyone here!

code:
#/bin/bash
list=`find . -name '*.cs' -o -name '*.h' -o -name '*.cpp'` 
for i in $list 
do
perl -i~ -ne 'if (/#region License/../#endregion/) {print if /#(?:end)?  region/;next};print' $i 
done
